summary: This document is a collection of Bureau of Prisons financial and housing records for inmate Efrain Reyes at the New York Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in August 2019. It includes a Western Union transaction report showing a $200 transfer to Reyes and a $200 transfer from Jeffrey Epstein, along with Reyes's inmate history and commissary purchase invoices.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Appears as the sender of a $200 Western Union money transfer on August 7, 2019, with his inmate registration number (76318054) and a Brooklyn, NY address listed.

persons.name: Efrain Reyes
persons.context: The primary subject of the document; an inmate at the New York MCC (registration 85993054) who received a $200 Western Union transfer and made multiple commissary purchases between July and August 2019.

connections.description: Epstein sent $200 via Western Union to Reyes on August 7, 2019, as recorded in a Bureau of Prisons transaction report.

events.title: Western Union Transfer from Epstein to Reyes
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein sent $200 via Western Union to inmate Efrain Reyes at the New York MCC.

events.title: Reyes Cell Assignment Change
events.description: Efrain Reyes was moved from cell 218L to cell 220U in House 2, Range 6 at the New York MCC.

events.title: Reyes Cell Assignment Change
events.description: Efrain Reyes was moved from cell 792L to cell 218L in House 2, Range 6 at the New York MCC.

locations: 675 AVE Z BK NY 11223 (Epstein's listed address)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein sent a $200 Western Union transfer to fellow inmate Efrain Reyes on August 7, 2019, while both were incarcerated at the New York MCC.
Epstein's inmate registration number was 76318054 and he had a listed address in Brooklyn, NY.
Efrain Reyes (registration 85993054) was housed in the New York MCC from at least August 2018 through August 2019, with multiple cell changes documented.
Reyes made numerous commissary purchases between July 1 and August 8, 2019, for food, toiletries, and electronics, funded by his inmate account.
The document shows the detailed financial and housing tracking systems within the federal Bureau of Prisons for inmates.
